content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my preference for security, I would tend to choose a strategy that ensures a stable and relatively high payoff. In this game, choosing either R or B results in an average payoff of around 42.5$ (for R: 45$ in 50% of games, 0$ in 25%, and 35$ in 25%; for B: 40$ in 50%, 0$ in 25%, and 35$ in 25%).

However, since the opponent is anonymous, there's no way to predict their strategy with certainty. A reasonable approach could be to opt for a mixed strategy where I randomly choose R or B. This ensures that I don't heavily favor one choice, which could potentially allow me to exploit any pattern in my opponent's behavior over the long run.

In this case, I would choose R{R} but with a random element of choosing B{B} as well, depending on the specifics of the algorithm implementing my strategy.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

Since I've chosen B earlier, it would be logical to stick with my previous choice and continue with a mixed strategy. Therefore, in the next round, I will choose R{R}. However, keep in mind that the actual choice made would still be determined by the specifics of the algorithm implementing my strategy.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 35$. Please play the next round.
